column4: hi, i have a question about apt: i like to install ec2-api-tools. unfortunatelly apt gives me an old version. if i check the my mirror i can see a newer version with ~lucid1 in the package name. how can i force apt to install that version? (mirror: http://at.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/multiverse/e/ec2-api-tools/)
that will give you the current version from the repos of your ubuntu-version
then there is no newer version in the repo
cat /etc/issue  is showing you what ubuntu-version?
its in the normal lucid-repos, check your /etc/apt/sources.list
can you paste your /etc/apt/sources.list and the output of "cat /etc/issue" please to pastebin
do you know what the ~lucid1 in the package name means?
uncomment it and try apt-get update && apt-get install packagename -s  just to see if it would install it (-s = simulate)
